title: Life Skills Training
shortDescription: Teaches practical daily living skills for greater independence.
description: Life skills training helps individuals with autism develop practical abilities needed for independent living. Programs focus on essential skills like personal hygiene, cooking, cleaning, money management, time management, using public transportation, and navigating community resources. Training is often hands-on and takes place in natural environments to promote generalization of skills to real-world situations.
benefits: Develops cooking and meal preparation skills
Prepares for independent or supported living
whoCanBenefit: Those transitioning out of school services
Individuals needing support with daily routines
